name: Node.js
description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine that allows developers to run JavaScript on the server-side.

name: NPM
description: Short for Node Package Manager, NPM is a package manager for Node.js that allows developers to easily install and manage dependencies for their projects.

name: Express
description: A popular web framework for Node.js that provides a robust set of features for building web applications, such as routing, middleware, and template rendering.

name: Callback
description: A function that is passed as an argument to another function and is called when the main function has completed its task.

name: Promise
description: An object that represents the eventual completion or failure of an asynchronous operation and allows developers to handle asynchronous code in a more synchronous way.

name: Async/Await
description: A language feature in JavaScript that allows developers to write asynchronous code that looks and behaves like synchronous code, making it easier to read and write.

name: Buffer
description: A class in Node.js that provides a way to handle binary data, such as reading and writing files and sockets.

name: Cluster
description: A module in Node.js that allows developers to create child processes to take advantage of multi-core systems and improve the performance of their applications.

name: EventEmitter
description: A class in Node.js that provides a way to handle events in a Node.js application, allowing developers to create custom events and react to them as needed.

name: HTTP
description: A module in Node.js that provides a way to handle HTTP requests and responses, allowing developers to build web servers and clients.
